greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (1 - phi(-q)^4)/ 8 in powers of q where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
Denoted by xi(n) in Glaisher 1907. - _Michael Somos_, May 17 2013
reference: G. Chrystal, Algebra: An elementary text-book for the higher classes of secondary schools and for colleges, 6th ed, Chelsea Publishing Co., New York 1959 Part II, p. 346 Exercise XXI(18). MR0121327 (22 #12066) J. W. L. Glaisher, On the representations of a number as the sum of two, four, six, eight, ten, and twelve squares, Quart. J. Math. 38 (1907), 1-62 (see p. 8).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
J. W. L. Glaisher, On the representations of a number as the sum of two, four, six, eight, ten, and twelve squares, Quart. J. Math. 38 (1907), 1-62 (see p. 4 and p. 8).
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
Index entries for sequences mentioned by Glaisher
formula: Expansion of (1 - eta(q)^8 / eta(q^2)^4) / 8 in powers of q.
a(n) = Sum_{d divides n} (-1)^(n/d + d) * d [Glaisher].
Multiplicative with a(2^e) = -3, if e>0. a(p^e) = (p^(e+1) - 1) / (p - 1) if p>2.
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, 0, -(-1)^n Sum[ If[ Mod[ d, 4] == 0, 0, d], {d, Divisors@n}]] (* _Michael Somos_, May 17 2013 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, 0, -(-1)^n * sumdiv( n, d, if( d%4, d)))}
(PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<1, 0, A = x * O(x^n); -1/8 * polcoeff( eta(x + A)^8 / eta(x^2 + A)^4, n))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jun 30 2005
